data.title: Administrative Services
data.meta_description: Administrative Services at CCBC supports an environment that encourages teaching and learning.
data.text:
Business services oversees planning and implementation of various student-related business transactions, such as the Bookstores, dining services, vending, payments and more.

Business Services

The Community College of Baltimore County comprises three main campuses and three extension centers. Each location's operations are managed locally.

Campus and Center Directors

Facilities Management is responsible for the operational maintenance, expansion and stewardship of the institutionâ€™s physical assets. They are responsible for building care, grounds, recycling, maintenance and the smooth operation of all campus amenities.

Facilities Management

Finance is responsible for the accounting and reporting practices of the college, including budget administration, annual budgeting and capital budgets.

CCBC Finance

The Human Resource Department oversees employment, compensation, benefits, employee, and labor relations and professional development.

Human Resources

Information Technology Services supports both students and staff through innovative technology-based services.

Information Technology

The Office of General Counsel (OGC) oversees legal inquiries, labor and employment, contracts and real-estate, as well as compliance with Federal Laws such as FERPA, Clery Act, Title IX and more. We care about legal issues of interest and importance to the campus community.

Legal Services

The mission of the CCBC Office of Planning, Research and Evaluation (PRE) is to lead and support the planning, evaluation and institutional research efforts of the Community College of Baltimore County. PRE provides institutional and programmatic research for the purposes of reporting to various state and federal agencies.

Planning, Research and Evaluation
